member.name: T:Agilent.OpenLab.Framework.UI.Layout.IDockingLayoutService
member.remarks:
The IDockingLayoutService provides an abstraction layer to one or more concrete docking layout implementations.
The docking layout service has the following responsibilities: - Provides docking control that hosts all UI modules that are visible in the active view/sub-view. - The current docking control configuration (this includes the visibility of UI modules and the position and size of the UI modules within the docking control) can be saved. - A saved configuration can be applied to the docking control. This allows restoring a previous layout. - The docking layout service triggers a module hidden or module shown event if any of the UI modules visibility changes, either by restoring a saved layout, or bu closing individual UI modules within the docking control.

member.name: E:Agilent.OpenLab.Framework.UI.Layout.IDockingLayoutService.ModuleHidden
member.remarks: This event is fired if a UI module becomes visible, i.e. by applying a docking configuration

member.name: E:Agilent.OpenLab.Framework.UI.Layout.IDockingLayoutService.ModuleShown
member.remarks: This event is fired if a UI module becomes invisible, i.e. the docking control associated with the UI module gets closed (either manually or by applying a docking configuration)

member.name: P:Agilent.OpenLab.Framework.UI.Layout.IDockingLayoutService.DockingControl
member.remarks: The UI element that hosts the docking control.

member.remarks: All the modules specified in the docking view will be added to the docking layout. Afterwards the docking configuration stored in the view is applied.

member.remarks: Removes all UI modules from the docking layout

member.remarks: The specified UI module will be hidden from the docking layout.

member.remarks: The configuration is stored with the currently active view object.

member.name: M:Agilent.OpenLab.Framework.UI.Layout.IDockingLayoutService.ShowModule(System.String)
member.remarks: The specified UI module will become visible within the docking layout.

member.name: T:Agilent.OpenLab.Framework.UI.Layout.IOutlookBarLayoutService
member.remarks:
The IOutlookbarLayoutService provides an abstraction layer to one or more concrete outlook bar layout implementations.
The outlook bar layout service has the following responsibilities: - Provides outlook bar like control. Each group within the outlook bar corresponds to a specific view. For each view there is a specified UI module that serves as the navigation module for this view. - The current outlook bar configuration (this includes the visibility of groups/views and the currently selected group/view, as well as the width of the control) can be saved. - A saved configuration can be applied to the outlook bar control. This allows restoring a previous layout. - The outlook bar service triggers a view deactivated event after a view was deactivated and a view activated view after a new view was activated.

member.name: E:Agilent.OpenLab.Framework.UI.Layout.IOutlookBarLayoutService.ViewActivated
member.remarks: This event is fired if a view becomes active, i.e. by clicking on the associated outlook bar group

member.name: E:Agilent.OpenLab.Framework.UI.Layout.IOutlookBarLayoutService.ViewDeactivated
member.remarks: This event is fired if a view gets deactivated, i.e. usually before a new view gets activated.

member.name: E:Agilent.OpenLab.Framework.UI.Layout.IOutlookBarLayoutService.BeforeViewActivated
member.remarks: This event is fired before a view becomes active, i.e. by clicking on the associated outlook bar group

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether [group visibility event active].
member.value: true if [group visibility event active]; otherwise, false.

member.remarks: The UI element that hosts the docking control.

member.name: M:Agilent.OpenLab.Framework.UI.Layout.IOutlookBarLayoutService.AddView(Agilent.OpenLab.Framework.UI.Layout.ModuleInterfaces.IUIModule,System.Windows.Controls.ContentControl)
member.param: The module info of the navigation module to be added.
The content control associated with the navigation module.
member.remarks: Use this method to add new group to the outlook bar. The new group is assocated with the specified view. The UI element shown in the outlook bar if this group/view is selected is the one specified as "contentControl".

member.remarks: Configures the layout of the outlook bar according to a previously stored layout file. This allows to restore the outlook bar from a previously stored status.

member.returns: Returns the serialized layout configuration of the outlook bar control
member.remarks: The layout includes which groups/views are visible, etc.

member.name: T:Agilent.OpenLab.Framework.UI.Layout.MenuInterfaces.IMenuService
member.remarks: The IMenuService provides an abstraction layer to one or more concrete menu service implementations. The menus service has the following responsibilities: - Provides a UI control to host all menu related tools. - Provides a selector of the active workspace. If the application consists of a single workspace, the workspace selector should be invisible and the unique workspace should be selected by default. An event is sent if the selected workspace changes. - Provides a selector of the active sub-view. If the active view consists of a single sub-view, the sub-view selector should be invisible and the unique sub-view should be selected by default. An event is sent if the selected sub-view changes. - Display the menu tools of the active controller modules for each hierarchical level, i.e. active application controller module, active workspace controller module, active view controller module and active sub view controller module. - Display the module tools of the active navigation UI module. - Display a module selector that allows selection of the visibility of each optional UI module belonging to the active view/sub view. Changing the visibility of a UI module will trigger either an module hidden or module shown event. - Display the module tools of all currently visible (active) UI modules of the active view/sub view. On initialization of UI modules, each UI module should register itself with the menu service. Menu service implementation needs to provide means to select/unselect individual UI modules in the module selector. A UI module providing module specific menu tools has to call CreateControllerModuleMenuGroup to register the UI module specific tools. The visibility of these menu tools is automatically handled by the menu service. A controller module providing module specific menu tools has to call CreateUIModuleMenu to register the controller module specific menu group. The visibility of the menu group is automatically handled by the menu service.

member.name: E:Agilent.OpenLab.Framework.UI.Layout.MenuInterfaces.IMenuService.CopySelectedSubView
member.remarks: This event is fired if the currently selected sub view needs to be copied.

member.name: E:Agilent.OpenLab.Framework.UI.Layout.MenuInterfaces.IMenuService.DeleteSelectedSubView
member.remarks: This event is fired if the currently selected sub view needs to be deleted.

member.name: E:Agilent.OpenLab.Framework.UI.Layout.MenuInterfaces.IMenuService.ModuleHidden
member.remarks: This event is fired if a UI module becomes invisible, i.e. the UI module is unchecked from the module selection tool.

member.name: E:Agilent.OpenLab.Framework.UI.Layout.MenuInterfaces.IMenuService.ModuleShown

member.remarks: This method is called from each controller module that needs to register a controller module specific menu group. How the menu group is actually used within the implementing service is up to the concrete service which is implementing this interface.

member.name: M:Agilent.OpenLab.Framework.UI.Layout.MenuInterfaces.IMenuService.CreateUIModuleMenu(Agilent.OpenLab.Framework.UI.Layout.MenuInterfaces.MenuDefinition)
member.remarks: This method is called from each UI module that needs to register UI module specific menu tools. How the tools defined in the module menu definition is actually used is up to the concrete service which is implementing this interface.

member.name: M:Agilent.OpenLab.Framework.UI.Layout.MenuInterfaces.IMenuService.FocusModule(System.String)
member.remarks: This method is called when a specific UI module gets the focus. The concrete implementation of this service can take the necessary action, like for example showing a contextual tab for the activated module.

members.member:
Gets the menu group manager.
The module id.
The .
This method is called from UI modules and controller modules to access menu groups, in order to inject menu tools.

member.name: M:Agilent.OpenLab.Framework.UI.Layout.MenuInterfaces.IMenuService.HideModule(System.String)
member.remarks: The specified UI module will be hidden from the menu service. Dependent on the concrete implementation this usally includes hiding the associated menu tools and unchecking the module selector.

member.name: M:Agilent.OpenLab.Framework.UI.Layout.MenuInterfaces.IMenuService.InitializeModuleSelectorTools(System.Collections.Generic.IList{System.String})
member.remarks: Use this method to specify which UI modules should be selectable in the module selector. Usually you would specify all UI modules that are visible and that have the required property set to false.

member.remarks: Each sub view needs to be registered with the menu service. The implementing has to provide a selector for the registered sub views. The sub view selector should only be visible if there is more than one sub view.

member.name: T:Agilent.OpenLab.Framework.UI.Layout.ModuleInterfaces.IControllerModule
member.remarks: The ControllerModuleService serves as a repository of controller modules. On initialization of controller modules, each controller module should register itself with the controller module service. On registration the module service stores the controller module. Other services or components can ask the controller module service for a registered controller.

member.name: M:Agilent.OpenLab.Framework.UI.Layout.ModuleInterfaces.IControllerModuleService.ContainsModule(System.String)
member.summary: Determines whether the specified module id contains module.
member.returns: true if the specified module id contains module; otherwise, false.

member.name: T:Agilent.OpenLab.Framework.UI.Layout.ModuleInterfaces.IUIModuleService
member.remarks: The UIModuleService serves as a repository of UI modules. On initialization of UI modules, each UI module should register itself with the UI module service. On registration the module service stores the UI module and the content control provided by each UI module. Other services or components can ask the UI module service for a registered UI module and its associated content control. Using the API of the module service UI modules can be activated and deactivated. UI modules that are not visible in the active view or sub view should always be deactivated whereas visible UI modules should always be activated. Only activated UI modules will process subscribed events. Deactivated UI modules should only monitor subscribed events and process them only if the UI module gets activated again. The UI module service fires a module focused event if any of the registered modules gets the focus (e.g. if a mouse click occurred within the UI module content region). One consumer of this event could be the menu service which might (depending on the actual implementation of the menu service) need to activate the UI module specific contextual ribbon tab.

member.name: E:Agilent.OpenLab.Framework.UI.Layout.ModuleInterfaces.IUIModuleService.ModuleFocused
member.remarks: This event is fired if a UI module becomes focused, for example if the mouse is clicked withing the UI module content area.

member.summary: Determines whether the specified module id contains module.
member.returns: true if the specified module id contains module; otherwise, false.

member.name: T:Agilent.OpenLab.Framework.UI.Layout.WorkspaceLayoutService
member.remarks: The WorkspaceLayoutService gives access to the workspace content control. This is the UI element that is associated with the currently active workspace, and corresponds to the applications main content area. The workspace content control always exists of a docking control, provided and managed by the IDockingLayoutservice, and optionally of an outlook bar control provided and managed by the IOutlookBarLayoutService. The visibility of the outlook bar depends on the type of the workspace. The outlook bar is only visible for workspaces that consist of multiple views. The workspace layout service allows activation of a workspace and saving the configuration of the currently active workspace. The workspace contains a complete description of the UI and controller modules that assemble the workspace and a description of the hierarchical organization of these elements. A workspace can consist of one or multiple views. For each view there will be an associated entry in the outlook bar that can be used to switch the active view. If the workspace consists of a single view the outlook bar is not visible. The implementation of the workspace layout service is also responsible to listen to and process the OnViewActivated and OnViewDeactivated events that are triggered by the outlook bar service, whenever a new view gets selected from the outlook bar control.

member.name: T:Agilent.OpenLab.Framework.UI.Layout.ApplicationLayoutService
member.remarks: The ApplicationLayoutService gives access to the workspace content control. This is the UI element that is associated with the currently active workspace, and corresponds to the applications main content area. The application layout service allows loading and saving an application configuration file. The application configuration file contains a complete description of the UI and controller modules that assemble the application and a description of the hierarchical organization of these elements. On the top level the application configuration file consists of individual workspaces. The implementation of the application layout service is responsible to register each of the workspaces defined in the application configuration file with the menu service, so that the workspace selector handled by the menu service is properly configured. The implementation of the application layout service is also responsible to listen to and process the OnWorkspaceChanged event that is triggered by the menu service, whenever a new workspace gets selected from the workspace selection tool.

member.name: T:Agilent.OpenLab.Framework.UI.Layout.WorkspacesValidator
member.remarks: The workspace validator has to check if a workspaces object is valid. In particular it has to check: - Workspaces must contain at least one workspace. - A multi view workspace may not contain views with the identical navigation module. - A navigation view may not have a docking module that is identical with the navigation module. - Any possible combination of active controller modules may not contain duplicates. - Docking view may not contain duplicated modules.

member.name: M:Agilent.OpenLab.Framework.UI.Layout.WorkspacesValidator.CheckDockingViewsDoesNotContainDuplicatedModules(Agilent.OpenLab.Framework.UI.Layout.Workspaces,System.Collections.Generic.IList{Agilent.OpenLab.Framework.UI.Layout.WorkspacesValidatorErrorType})
member.summary: Checks the docking view does not contain duplicated modules.

member.summary: Checks the navigation views does not contain docking modules that are identical to navigation module.

member.summary: Checks the workspace does not contain views with identical navigation modules.

member.summary: Checks the workspaces contains at least one workspace.

member.summary: Checks the workspaces does not contain duplicate active controller modules.

member.summary: Checks the workspaces does not contain duplicate active controller modules.
The check multi view workspaces does not contain duplicate active controller modules.
The check single view workspaces does not contain duplicate active controller modules.
